titles.title: Tobacco Advertising Subsidies and Health Enhancement Strategies Act
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to disallow the deduction for advertising or other promotion expenses with respect to sales of tobacco products.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR H4084)
Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 6/28/1993--Introduced. Tobacco Advertising Subsidies and Health Enhancement Strategies Act - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to disallow any deduction for tobacco product sale promotion expenses. Requires any additional revenues to the Treasury to be used for deficit reduction purposes. Prohibits such revenues from being considered for any purpose under the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 (Gramm-Rudman-Hollings Act).
